Description: Cost-Push Inflation: The calculated inflation rate based on changes in the firm's labor, material, and capital costs. It is a direct input into the firm's price-setting rule in the original model.
Effective Labor Productivity: The final labor productivity value used in the Leontief production function, adjusted downwards for any shortages of capital or materials.
Expected Change in Deposits: A temporary cash flow projection used to determine if the firm will have a cash surplus or deficit, which then informs its demand for new loans (DL_d_i).
Quantity Adjustment Signal: The core of the CANVAS demand-pull logic. It represents the percentage by which a firm decides to adjust its production quantity based on market feedback.
Price Adjustment Signal: The other half of the CANVAS demand-pull logic. It represents the percentage by which a firm decides to adjust its price.
Global Price List: A temporary vector combining the prices of all domestic firms and foreign importers into a single list for buyers to search from.
Global Supply List: A temporary vector combining the total available goods (inventory + new production) from all domestic firms and foreign importers.
Firm-to-Firm Demand Matrix: A temporary matrix that tracks the specific demand of each firm `i` for the intermediate goods produced by sector `g`.
